taskbody.context: A DITA map offers the possibility of grouping different types of links between topics in a relationship table.

step.cmd: Edit the DITA map file where you want to create the relationship table.
Place the cursor in the DITA map at the location where you want to insert the relationship table.
Run the action Insert Relationship Table. The action is available in the DITA Relationship Table menu, in the toolbar, and in the Relationship Table submenu of the contextual menu.
step.stepresult: This action displays the Insert Relationship Table dialog.

step.cmd: Set the parameters of the relationship table that will be created: the number of rows, the number of columns, a table title (optional), a table header (optional).
Set the type of the topics in the header of each column.
step.info: The header of the table (the relheader element) already contains a relcolspec element for each table column. You should set the value of the attribute type of each relcolspec element to a value like concept, task, reference. When you click in the header cell of a column (that is a relcolspec element) you can see all the attributes of that relcolspec element including the type attribute in the Attributes view. You can edit the attribute type in this view.

step.cmd: Place the cursor in a table cell and run the action Insert Reference to insert a topic reference in that cell.
Optionally for adding a new row to the table / removing an existing row you should run the action Insert Relationship Row/ Delete Relationship Row.
step.info: These actions are available in the toolbar, in the menu DITA Relationship Table and in the Relationship Table submenu of the contextual menu.

step.cmd: Optionally for adding a new column to the table / removing an existing column you should run the action Insert Relationship Column/ Delete Relationship Column.
step.info: These actions are available in the toolbar, in the menu DITA Relationship Table and in the Relationship Table submenu of the contextual menu.
